title: Ticket #2769: Race condition in Procd startup
description:
In the cmd_status_shows-startd test Greg and I observed a race condition in the procd startup.

The startd launches the procd, but when it looks for the procd_pipe.STARTD.watchdog it does not (yet) exist.

01/13/12 14:09:38 error opening watchdog pipe /slots/04/dir_37670/userdir/condor_tests/cmd_status_shows-startd.saveme/60322/60322scheddone/log/procd_pipe.STARTD.watchdog: No such file or directory (2)

The problem is that the procd has not finished starting up to create the pipe. There are at least two possible solutions. 1) The daemon that starts the procd can create the pipes for it (similar to how the master works) and pass the pipes to the procd 2) The daemon that starts the procd can wait until the procd is ready.
